channel.title: Boston Digital Humanities
channel.description: Recent content on Boston Digital Humanities

item.title: 2024 Call for Proposals
item.description: Submission deadline: January 31st, 2024 Symposium: Friday, April 12, 2024 We invite submissions for participation in a one day symposium of greater Boston-area scholars, community members, library and archives professionals, students, and practitioners across disciplines who engage with digital approaches, pedagogy, and methods in humanities and social sciences research on Friday, April 12, 2024. The symposium will be a day of learning, engagement, and community building. Sessions will occur in person on Tuftsâ€™ Medford campus; a hybrid option will be available to those who are unable to attend in person.

item.title: 2024 Symposium
item.description: The Greater Boston Digital Research and Pedagogy Symposium is a city-wide gathering of students, scholars, and practitioners working at the intersection of technology and the humanities. Hosted at a different institution each year, the Symposium is a key site for promoting cross-institutional collaboration and showcases the diverse perspectives of our field. The Tufts University Libraries are excited to host the third Greater Boston Digital Research and Pedagogy Symposium on April 12th, 2024.
